questions.question_text:
Complete the sentence. In a gap analysis, a building block that appears in the Target Architecture but does not appear in the Baseline Architecture indicates
_____

choices.E: a new function that must be built or procured
choices.B: an error has occurred and the architecture must be re-evaluated
choices.C: requirements have not been properly documented

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: E
I think E

Where an ABB from the Target Architecture cannot be found in the Baseline Architecture,
mark it at the intersection with the "New" row as a gap that needs to filled, either by
developing or procuring the building block
Architecture Governance Framework Conceptual Framework has: Context, Process, Content, Repository,Process Flow Control

Selected Answer: E
https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf9-doc/arch/chap44.html#tag_44_02_01

context, process, content, process flow control and repository
The answer is E. Refer to Chapter 44.2 Architecture Governance Framework and Governance framework consists of: process, content, process flow control and repository. There is no Vision.
Governance framework consists of: process, content, process flow control and repository. There is another wrong answer here!

comments.content:
"The split of process, content, and context are key to the support of the Architecture Governance initiative, by allowing the introduction of new governance material (legal, regulatory, standards based, or legislative) without unduly impacting the processes. This content-agnostic approach ensures that the framework is flexible. The processes are typically independent of the content and implement a proven best practice approach to active governance."
so I think Context is also included in Governance Framework.
If you see figure 44-1 Context is reported there as well.

questions.question_text: Complete the sentence. All of the following are parts of the conceptual structure of the TOGAF Architecture Governance Framework, except ______

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
For E - it is the architecture principles which provides the basis and Architecture board is the one which ensures that Architecture principles are referred and followed.
E is the correct answer .Chapter 4 Architecture Board from TOGAF® Standard — Enterprise Architecture Capability and Governance
Architecture board does not approve business plans. So given answer is correct.

choices.D: identifying and approving components for reuse
choices.E: providing the basis for all decision-making with regard to changes to the architecture
choices.B: approving the strategic business plans proposed by individual organization units within the enterprise

questions.question_text: Complete the sentence. The Architecture Board is typically responsible and accountable for achieving all of the following goals except ___________

choices.A: An artifact contains one or more deliverables
choices.C: Deliverables are prepared by the Project Manager, whereas artifacts are defined by the Architect
choices.B: Artifacts and deliverables are synonymous; there is no difference between them
choices.E: Deliverables are specified as contractual outputs from a project, whereas artifacts are not
choices.D: Deliverables are reusable, whereas artifacts are unique to a given architecture project

questions.question_text: In TOGAF, what is the difference between an artifact and a deliverable?

discussion.content: Option E is the correct answer

Option E is the correct answer.

Both Artifacts and Deliverables are outputs produced during the architecture development process in TOGAF.
Artifacts include the document and models created throughout the process.
Deliverables refer to formal and significant outputs that mark the completion of a phase.

Selected Answer: E
E.
From ch32 of https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf9-doc/arch/, deliverables are typically the contractual or formal work products of an architecture project.
E. Deliverables are specified as contractual outputs from a project, whereas artifacts are not

An Architecture Compliance review is a scrutiny of the compliance of a speciﬁc project against established architectural criteria, spirit, and business objectives.
Answer is C

questions.question_text: Which of the following best describes the purpose of an architecture compliance review?

choices.C: To review a project against established architecture criteria and business objectives
choices.D: To ensure that stakeholder concerns are being addressed by a project
choices.B: To review a project for compliance to external laws and regulations
choices.A: To review the validity of a project's Architecture Vision
